column4: Is there a way I can share the wireless internet on my laptop with another computer through ethernet
with what purpose?
So the other computer can access the internet
Think of the laptop as a bridge
I wouldn't operate like that since the speed of your internet is going to be adapted to the speed of your wireless connection
Yes, well my internet connection is too slow for it to matter
then why bring it even more down, since you have a wireless connection you have a wifi modem, if so you should have at least 4 ethernet ports available to plug in your 2nd computer
It is in another room
no need to bridge, you also need to be aware that both computers need to be active in order to make that internet connection work
if your laptop is going into hybernation you don't have internet on your computer
not good for a laptop
what is the current layout of your network
then buy yourself an ethernet cable and connect this with 1 of your routers and plug it in straight away into your desktop
It will have to be a long ethernet cable :/
why? are you not able to move the wifi routers?
Yeah.
then play with that try to enlarge the range between these 2 routers in order to get a internet cable that can be plugged into your computer
Will do.
it's also better that 1 pc in the network is connected through cable to your routers/modem you'd get funny situations if you do a reset of your wifi and you loose internet because of that :p
There are 2 iMacs plugged in to one of the routers
ok
